intro: Hieracium orthorrhizon, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium orthorrhizon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
